title: Logo ID Mania!
content:
Hello all,   
   
I realize that logotypes can be a bit challenging since many are modified or even custom drawn. I was wondering, however, if you guys can come up with Id's on these.   
   
Time: I have no idea what this is   
   
Gucci: Americana is close but not it exactly, is there something obvious I'm missing?   
   
Le Coq Sportif: This looks like modified Franklin Gothic but I don't think that's it since the e and 'c' have horizontal lines at the end of the stroke whereas in FG they are slanted. Any ideas?   
   
Johnston & Murphy-I've come across fonts that look similar but none has the distinctive ampersand.   
   
I'm doing this for a spoof poster where I'lll need to modify the logos to read something different but similar as in Johnston and Murphy -\> Jason and Murrray. It's non commercial project for a student organization. Any help would be greatly appreciated as always.   
   
Logos:   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110413112959im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/18338.jpg)
author: James Gareth

comments.content:
I can't help you with the Time logo, but try TF Arrow for Gucci, one of the Grotesques (Monotype or Bureau) for Le Coq, and Goudy Old Style for J&M.   
   
(These are all just faces that will get you close, not the definitive sources of the logos in question.)

Time was definetly hand drawn and I would guess Gucci was too. You will have to fake the look. Are you good at Illustrator or Freehand? Choose a close font create outlines and manipulate the points. Dan
